messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Backyard Bird Count this weekend
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 02/17/2001 3:06:04 AM !!!First Boot!!!, ... We re doing it.  This is our 2nd time and it is a lot of fun!  And Gramma and my sister have
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 02/17/2001 3:06:04 AM !!!First Boot!!!,
diamondair@... writes:


I hadn't seen this mentioned yet on this list (though I'm behind on digests,
so I apologize if this is a repeat)...
The Audubon Society and Cornell Lab of Ornithology sponsor a backyard bird
count every year. You just count the birds in your backyard (or elsewhere),
and submit it via their website at:

http://birdsource.cornell.edu/gbbc





We're doing it.  This is our 2nd time and it is a lot of fun!  And Gramma and
my sister have joined in too

Nance

messages.subject: Backyard Bird Count this weekend
messages.msgSnippet: I hadn t seen this mentioned yet on this list (though I m behind on digests, so I apologize if this is a repeat)... The Audubon Society and Cornell Lab of
messages.messageBody:
I hadn't seen this mentioned yet on this list (though I'm behind on digests,
so I apologize if this is a repeat)...
The Audubon Society and Cornell Lab of Ornithology sponsor a backyard bird
count every year. You just count the birds in your backyard (or elsewhere),
and submit it via their website at:

http://birdsource.cornell.edu/gbbc

Just thought some of you might be interested in doing this with your kiddos.
Mackenzie and I just got finished entering our bird-tracking data from
today. Tomorrow we're going to make reports from several different sites.
Fun!

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) "This is a great life!"
and Asa (10/5/99) Who walks backwards
http://www.geocities.com/the_clevengers Flying Clevenger Family
